cmCourseInfo.description: How do innovations become useful in society? What is needed for a company to use such innovations successfully? Why and how do individuals and companies commercialize new ideas or technologies? This course provides a broad introduction to entrepreneurship, entrepreneurial skills and the methodology used by entrepreneurs to start a new venture.
cmCourseInfo.title: Introduction to Entrepreneurship
cmCourseInfo.recommendedPreparation: The course is targeted at students from all disciplines (science, humanities, social sciences), who are interested in entrepreneurship.

cmCourseInfo.description: How do innovations become useful in society? What is needed for a company to use such innovations successfully? Why and how do individuals and companies commercialize new ideas or technologies? This course provides a broad introduction to entrepreneurship, entrepreneurial skills and the methodology used by entrepreneurs to start a new venture.
cmCourseInfo.title: Introduction to Entrepreneurship
cmCourseInfo.recommendedPreparation: The course is targeted at students from all disciplines (science, humanities, social sciences), who are interested in entrepreneurship.

cmCourseInfo.description: This experiential learning course allows students to explore the inner working of new ventures or other innovative organizations. The majority of the course consists of activities applying entrepreneurial concepts within a local organization, with oversight from the Centre for Entrepreneurship. In-class activities facilitate the application of entrepreneurial tools to develop the students’ entrepreneurial skills.
cmCourseInfo.title: Exploring New Ventures
cmCourseInfo.recommendedPreparation: The experiential learning activities are designed to accommodate students from all disciplines including science, social sciences and humanities.

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions

Students undertake an academic internship with a startup company, in addition to meeting regularly in class to discuss and share their experiences. The course is designed to provide students with an opportunity to apply academic learning in a professional context, build their network, and explore entrepreneurship as a potential career path. Students will be required to complete a placement over the duration of the course. Students work with staff at the Centre to secure their internship with our partner organizations.

Enrolment is by application only.  

The department will review the application and email the decision via email to the student. If accepted, you will receive the follow-up instruction, and the department admin will enroll you on ACORN. Final acceptance into the course is dependent on the official acceptance of a student as an intern with a partner organization.
